summary: I’ll love you big or small
body:
I’ll love you big or small

It’s been ages and I apologize but here’s a fic I’ve been thinking about writing for a while. I’m on mobile so hopefully it’s not too bad!


Another day, another mess. The Avengers can never seem to catch a break. This time your poor boyfriend Steve, is the unfortunate soul caught up in the trouble. With Thor bringing Loki to live in the tower, there’s been a bit more mischief around. You and Steve have been together for a little over 2 years, him having met you after rescuing you from a Hydra facility. It had taken a long time for you to become used to being treated like a person again after being captive and experimented on for years. You were a mutant having the powers of the elements on your side. You still struggled with your demons and had bad days but no matter what Steve was always by your side. That’s why with the chaos of the day you knew you wouldn’t leave Steve’s side….


“LOKI! What did you do?!” you heard an angry Steve shout.

“Nothing Captain, I can assure you. It was all you. I did not tell you to wish for your old self…” the trickster laughed.

“Had I’d known you were up to your tricks I never would held this thing and answered your question!”


You couldn’t stand it anymore and walked into the living room to find Steve swimming in his clothes. He was your height, tiny and frail looking. “S-Steve? Is that you?”

His eyes widened and he threw the shiny rock he was holding back to Loki so he could attempt to hold his pants up. “H-hey doll. Uhm, yeah it’s me. I’m really sorry you have to see me like this” he glared at Loki, “change me back!”

“I cannot. The spell will wear off on its own. Good luck Captain!” He said as he disappeared.

Steve sighed and stood there awkwardly. “Loki handed me that rock and asked me if I ever wished I had my preserum body back. I said yeah I do wish that sometimes and now I..I look like this. Doll you okay? You haven’t said anything…”

“Wow, it’s just..you look so different.” You walked over and reached out to touch him but he pulled away. “Steve?”

“Stop Y/N I don’t need your pity. Just leave me alone okay?” He huffed as he stepped back.

“Steve stop being stupid. I’m not pitying you. Come here, I-“

“No, I can see the way you’re looking at me. You always said you’d love me no matter what but you don’t love me like this,” he gestured to himself.

You stepped closer to him only to have him step back again. “Steve, baby, please listen to me. I want to help you, I love you, please just give me a chance. You’re not even listening to me, let’s order you some clothes that fit and we can have dinner and talk about all this-“

“I just want to be alone right now. Just go Y/N” he sighed and turned away.

With tears in your eyes you nodded and headed to the elevator, “I’m not leaving you and I’m not gonna stop loving you just because of this. It’s only temporary. Loki said so. I’m staying with Bucky until you decide you still want me. Good bye Steve” you waited until the doors closed before you let yourself cry. When the doors finally opened on Bucky’s floor you walked out and tried to pull yourself together.


“Y/N? Hey, what’s wrong?” Bucky asked from the couch looking concerned. You explained everything to him in detail and he straightened up. “Well he’ll come around doll. He’s stubborn you and I both know that but that’s no excuse on his part. You can stay with me till he pulls his head out his ass” he snorted.

“Thank you Buck.” You wiped your eyes and calmed down. “It just hurts because he knows I fell in love with him for him, not what he looks like. I’d love him no matter what. I don’t care if he’s big or small. I just want him to let me help him.”

“Give him time. Why don’t you order him some clothes and us some pizza and we’ll hang out till that punk comes to join us?”

“Mmm that sounds perfect!” You set about ordering the pizza and let Bucky help you pick out clothes for Steve. After the pizza finally arrived and you were halfway through a movie, the doors opened to Bucky’s floor.


Steve shuffled out of the elevator wearing a shirt and pair of sweats that belonged to you. You almost smiled at him but you held it back, waiting for an apology. “Hey guys…can I join you?”

“Don’t you have something you need to say to Y/N Steven?” Bucky looked pointedly at Steve.

He walked over slowly and sat down next to you taking your hands in his, “sweetheart I’m so sorry I treated you so badly. It was awful of me to talk to you like that and I know you were just trying to help me. I just…I don’t feel as confident in this body. Back then? No girl would give me the time of day. No dame wanted a little guy like me. I guess I was scared that you’d wanna break things off with me if I looked like this. I’m so stupid and I’m so sorry. But I understand if you still don’t want to date me, I-“

You shut him up with kiss, ignoring the gagging sounds Bucky started making. “Steve Rogers you know good and well I love you for who you are and not what you look like. I love you for your heart.” You kissed each of his hands softly. “I’m not gonna leave you, you goof. You’re mine forever. Besides I always wanted to be the big spoon and now I get to” you teased.

“Very funny doll” he grinned. “Thank you for being the best thing that ever happened to me”

“I’m sorry but I’m eating this pizza because it’s getting cold, can you saps please hurry this up?” Bucky interrupted as he opened the pizza box and started eating. You rolled your eyes,

“Sure thing Buck. But next time you and Nat have a moment I’m totally ruining it. Let’s eat Stevie.” You grabbed a slice for you and for Steve and began to eat in comfortable silence…that is until a certain genius decided to pop by.


“Hey Barnes I finished the blueprints for that upgrade-Holy Shit! Cap got deflated! Spangles is now sprinkles! OMG” he kept on and on until Bucky threw a pillow at him.

“Tony shut up, Steve can still kick your ass. You ever seen a chihuahua get angry?” He snickered as Steve send him a mocking glare.

“Alright guys that’s enough, Tony come eat then you can oogle over Steve.” You said as you motioned to the pizza box.

“I gotta start coming out of the lab more often. I could’ve missed this.” Tony said as he plopped down. Yeah there was never a dull moment with the Avengers but you couldn’t be happier with your new family.

“I gotta start coming out of the lab more often. I could’ve missed this.” Tony said as he plopped down. Yeah there was never a dull moment with the Avengers but you couldn’t be happier with your new family.

summary: what most antis don't understand about tony's characters growth is that it wasn't linear. he didn't just see that what he was...
body: what most antis don’t understand about tony’s characters growth is that it wasn’t linear. he didn’t just see that what he was doing was bad, fix it, and never make another mistake. he fixed one mistake, then another would pop up, then another and another and another. if you just watch all the cap movies and the avengers movies, then you’re not going to understand tony’s story at all. you won’t understand the meaning behind ultron or the depth of his child abuse and you won’t even know about his anxiety problems. if you still dislike tony after watching the iron man movies, thats your choice, i don’t care. he’s not the most likable character by any means. but its one thing to dislike a character after you’ve weighed everything thats happened to them and everything they’ve been through than to only know surface level characteristics and ignorantly describe their personality and actions.

summary: Hey guys! I’m thinking of coming back into writing for this beloved fandom again. I’m fairly new but I am definitely not a new...
caption:
Hey guys! I’m thinking of coming back into writing for this beloved fandom again. I’m fairly new but I am definitely not a new writer. @knightofnarnia was my first tumblr blog for writing but I’ve written before in the past on dA and I have my own stories I keep for myself :) 

I have a finished fic already but I won’t be posting that for a while but I do have two Peter Paker fic in the works. The first will be a mini series and I already have one part finished! The second is still being worked out.

Just a little reminder, I do requests and ships but requests are closed. So if you want a ship send it in! 

Upcoming Stories || Masterlist

peter parker

jar of stars ||  coming soon

(Y/n) has a thing for paper stars. They also have a thing for Peter Parker but then a little bitsy spider comes round and practically plays matchmaker.

untitled peter parker fic || in the works

Not sure where I want to go with this but it’s a story during his freshman year when he got bit. Uncle Ben is still here and I’m planning to make it super angsty! Not a happy ending either o: (this isn’t the summary btw lol)

misc.

the calm into the storm || coming soon

The world was calm, it continued to exist as the UN hid what happened to Tony Stark to the world and what was happening in Wakanda. But people continued to live life, knowing that whatever was happening, if something was going to happen, the world would be alright as long as they had the Avengers. Or at least whoever was left over. However, the repercussions of the Avengers’ loss would be felt by the people of the world, and it was too late for them to even realize.

summary: When your BFF hates Iron Man...
title: When your BFF hates Iron Man...
body:
My best friend hates Iron Man but I adore the angel, so when we watch the movies we play a fun little drinking game that gets us both fuckedddd up. 

I take a shot anytime Tony does something utterly adorable. She takes a shot anytime he does something super annoying.

…We end up drinking at the same fucking parts… xD

summary: I wish you would write a fic where Tony and Loki live happily ever after with very little hurt/death. So. Much. Fluff. The world...
question: I wish you would write a fic where Tony and Loki live happily ever after with very little hurt/death. So. Much. Fluff. The world needs it. Maybe they have a kid or open a cafe or go adopt a cat and have trouble deciding which one.
answer:
A little less conversation, A little more Action please

Tony twists his fingers together, eyes locked on the tall fencing just outside the window. They had been here for hours already, through lazy bursts of rain and speckles of sunlight. Through arguments, threats and promises made under the breath.

“I don’t think we are ready for such a thing.”

“It’s not that big of a decision,” Tony replies softly, not taking his eyes off the fence. He can’t look at the other man right now. Not after he brought up role models and parents.

“Stark, you—“

“I told you not to ‘Stark’ me just because we don’t agree on something.”

“Anthony.”

Tony can’t help it, he cracks a rueful smile at the name and turns away from the window. Across the room, tucked into the far corner, Loki sits with a pleading look on his face.

“I’m putting my foot down,” Tony says to that face.

Loki looks down at his lap, something desperate creeping into his eyes. He whispers, “but…”

“I said three at the most, Loki.”

One of the at least ten kittens curled up in the god wiggles one of its legs free and stretches its toes. Loki’s pleading expression intensifies when he looks up.

“Anthony!”

“Lokes.”

“Anthony.”

Tony scrunches up his face and grumbles, “Stop it—stop. You’re disgusting. You disgust me.”

“They love me,” Loki replies, almost reverent. “Unconditionally.”

“So do I,” Tony huffs. “Except my one condition that we don’t become crazy old cat dads together.”

“I knew mentioning our bad upbringings would irk you.”

“So why did you bring it up?”

“I am… emotionally compromised at the moment.”

Tony snickers behind a hand and lolls his head to the side so he can consider the furry mass of kittens covering the god’s body. It is a rare sight to see. Loki, actually relaxed when outside of the tower. Usually the god puts on his mask before they go forth into the public eye. The impenetrable facade that takes more effort than Loki lets on. If only they had known Loki’s emotional weak point was a few kittens back when he was attacking the city.

Tony’s smile slips a little.

No, maybe not.

“They came to me, seeking nourishment and comfort,” Loki is saying, almost to himself. His eyes are fixed on the kittens again, like Tony isn’t even in the room. This is going to be a problem.

“I’m not going to have ten—“

“Twelve.”

“Twelve kittens running around the suite.” Tony sighs as Loki gives the orange one a pet. “They aren’t even potty trained.”

“They are very well behaved,” Loki argues, looking almost hurt that Tony would call his babies misbehaved.

“We’d need at least six litter boxes.”

“It’s not as though you don’t have the money.”

“Do you know how much one litter box smells?”

Loki narrows his eyes. “Do you?”

Tony blinks and moves past that because okay, no, he doesn’t. But it’s an open pan full of waste. It can’t smell good.

“Loki, we would have to take time off from saving people and dates and—“

“We stay home most nights anyway,” Loki shoots back. “And I keep telling you, no one wants me showing up to ‘save’ them.”

Tony’s lips twitch down, but he stops himself from showing anything. They’ve had this argument too many times already, and Loki’s made it crystal clear he won’t be pitied. Not that Tony pities him, but any signs of regret or sadness over Loki’s issues with the public tend to be unwelcome.

It’s still no excuse to get twelve kittens.

“Loki—“

“I’m getting them whether you like it or not,” the god snaps at last, several of the kittens standing up and hissing in Tony’s direction. He’s clearly done pleading.

Tony lets his body slump down to the table, his head clanging quietly against he metal.

“How did I know that was coming?” He wrinkles his nose at the antiseptic smell of the metal, and thinks of the fence. The small cages the vets brought them around to before suggesting they visit the Play Room. A single room just barely big enough for a table, two chairs, and a carpet-covered chunk of wood.

He thinks of Loki’s face when he first sat down and every kitten in the room ran to him.

Tony sits up and finds Loki staring at him with the same stubborn look on his face. He knew this was going to be hard, but he thought getting a cat would be a good trial run for future adoptions. Something easy, something they could do together without arguing.

Tony sighs.

Yeah, he was optimistic for once in his life. Sue him.  

“Alright, I guess we—“

“I will let you name one of them,” Loki interrupts, all semblance of ‘I’ll fight you’ gone in seconds. His entire being has brightened, all twelve kittens are mewling happily, and yeah, this is going to be super fun.

But damn, is it worth it.

A little less conversation, A little more Action please

Tony twists his fingers together, eyes locked on the tall fencing just outside the window. They had been here for hours already, through lazy bursts of rain and speckles of sunlight. Through arguments, threats and promises made under the breath.

Tony blinks and moves past that because okay, no, he doesn’t. But it’s an open pan full of waste. It can’t smell good.

“Loki, we would have to take time off from saving people and dates and—“

“We stay home most nights anyway,” Loki shoots back. “And I keep telling you, no one wants me showing up to ‘save’ them.”

Tony’s lips twitch down, but he stops himself from showing anything. They’ve had this argument too many times already, and Loki’s made it crystal clear he won’t be pitied. Not that Tony pities him, but any signs of regret or sadness over Loki’s issues with the public tend to be unwelcome.

It’s still no excuse to get twelve kittens.

“Loki—“

“I’m getting them whether you like it or not,” the god snaps at last, several of the kittens standing up and hissing in Tony’s direction. He’s clearly done pleading.

Tony lets his body slump down to the table, his head clanging quietly against he metal.

“How did I know that was coming?” He wrinkles his nose at the antiseptic smell of the metal, and thinks of the fence. The small cages the vets brought them around to before suggesting they visit the Play Room. A single room just barely big enough for a table, two chairs, and a carpet-covered chunk of wood.

He thinks of Loki’s face when he first sat down and every kitten in the room ran to him.

Tony sits up and finds Loki staring at him with the same stubborn look on his face. He knew this was going to be hard, but he thought getting a cat would be a good trial run for future adoptions. Something easy, something they could do together without arguing.

Tony sighs.

Yeah, he was optimistic for once in his life. Sue him.  

“Alright, I guess we—“

“I will let you name one of them,” Loki interrupts, all semblance of ‘I’ll fight you’ gone in seconds. His entire being has brightened, all twelve kittens are mewling happily, and yeah, this is going to be super fun.

But damn, is it worth it.
trail.content_abstract:
A little less conversation, A little more Action please

Tony twists his fingers together, eyes locked on the tall fencing just outside the window. They had been here for hours already, through lazy bursts of rain and speckles of sunlight. Through arguments, threats and promises made under the breath.

summary: I’m rewatching Agent Carter and I realized something.  can you imagine how Edwin Jarvis felt when Tony was born?  He would have...
body:
I’m rewatching Agent Carter and I realized something.

 can you imagine how Edwin Jarvis felt when Tony was born?

He would have cried so much.  Maybe not so much in front of Howard and Maria because he has to be composed and all but he definitely cried tears of sadness and guilt when he found himself alone that night. 

And even before that while Maria was pregnant and he had to take care of her. Maybe he had some comfort in doing that because he still got a chance of taking take care of someone he loved while they brought a child into the world. 

And yet the ache was still there. If not prominent, it was still in the back of his mind for sure. The thing he could never have. 

I’m sad now
